When we are babies, our bodies grow strong. As we grow up, our bodies change. We get taller and heavier. But as we get older, our bodies start to slow down. Our skin gets wrinkly and our hair gets gray. Our hearts beat slower and our bodies don't work as fast. This is because our bodies have a special clock that makes us get older. We can't stop the clock, but we can take care of our bodies to stay healthy. We can eat good food, exercise, and get plenty of sleep. When humans get older, they change in many ways. Their skin gets wrinkly, and they may lose some of their hair. As people age, their bodies don't work as well. They might not be able to run as fast or lift as much. Some humans get sick more easily when they are older. This happens because our bodies have a special clock inside that counts down how long we live. It starts when we are born, and it never stops. The clock makes our bodies change over time. We can't stop the clock, but we can try to take good care of ourselves. That way, we can feel better for as long as we can. This will help us live a happy and healthy life.  (200 words)

We can eat healthy food, exercise, and get enough sleep. These things can help us stay strong and healthy for a long time.
